text: AUDITOR-GENERALS REPORT ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS QUESTION BY PRIVATE NOTICE:
Number of Ministers in the National Government as per
the Constitution Police Shooting at Kataragama SCARCITY OF TAMIL MEDIUM TECHNICAL OFFICERS IN DEPARTMENT OF METEOROLOGY: Statement by Minister of Disaster Management
Read a Second, and the Third time, and passed as
. The Parliament met at 1.00 p.m., MR. SPEAKER [THE HON. KARU JAYASURIYA] in the Chair.
MEETING OF COMMITTEE ON PARLIAMENTARY BUSINESS

SCHOOLS IN RATNAPURA DISTRICT: APPOINTMENTS OF
(i) the number of National Schools and schools
governed by the Provincial Council functioning in Ratnapura District separately;
(ii) out of them, the number of schools that do
(iv) whether it is admitted that a large number of

( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam - Minister of Education) , .
1579/57 5. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Bandula Gunawardane on behalf of the Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara) - (2 :
asked the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy: (a) Will he inform this House-
(i) whether he is aware that steps were taken by the previous Government to construct the Broadlands Hydropower Plant in Kalukohutenna, Kitulgala with the Chinese aid; and

(ii) whether he admits that while pledges were made to pay suitable compensation for lands of the residents of the aforesaid village that were taken over by the government for the said project, residents of
Kegalle District have been paid a paltry sum as compensation even though compensation was paid to residents of Nuwara Eliya District?
(b) Will he also inform this House whether he would look into this and take steps to pay sufficient compensation to residents of Kegalle District as well?
(ICBC - Industrial and Commercial Bank of China) .
) ( - ) (The Hon. Heshan Withanage on behalf of the Hon. Nalin
asked the Minister of Power and Renewable Energy:
(i) whether he is aware that a section specially vested with responsibility for developing renewable energy does not exist in the structure of the Ceylon Electricity Board;

(ii) whether technical challenges that may arise in adding renewable energy to the national electricity grid in an optimum manner can be overcome in the absence of a division dedicated for developing renewable energy; and
(iii) of the reason for the negative attitude shown by the Ceylon Electricity Board towards renewable energy?
: DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC PLAYGROUND IN ALUTHGAMA:
) ( - ) (The Hon. BandulaGunawardane on behalf of the Hon. Piyal Nishantha De Silva) -(2):
asked the of Provincial Councils and Local Government:
(i) the public playground of Aluthgama belonging to the Beruwala Pradeshiya Sabha is maintained by the said Pradeshiya Sabha; and
(ii) the playground concerned was renovated and developed a year ago?
(i) the amount of provision granted for the development activities and the year in which it was granted;
(ii) whether the specified tender procedure has been followed in developing the playground;
(iii) if not, the reasons for it;
(iv) who the contractors of the project are; and
(v) whether the total amount of money approved for the project has been utilized for the aforesaid project?

(i) whether the recommendation of the Minister representing the area is required for obtaining approval from the Beruwala Pradeshiya Sabha to book the playground for a festival/ sports event/ social event;
(ii) if so, the reason for it;
(iii) whether engaging in sports in this playground has been banned for sports clubs in the area; and
(iv) if so, the reasons underlying it?
: DAMAGE CAUSED BY FLOODS AND LANDSLIDES:
) ( - ) (The Hon. BandulaGunawardane on behalf of the Hon. Jayantha Samaraweera) - (5 :
asked the Minister of Disaster Management:

(i) the number of houses, toilets and drinking water wells in the Kalutara District which were totally, partially and slightly damaged by the floods and landsides that occurred on 27.05.2017, separately
(ii) that number in relation to each Grama Niladhari Division and Divisional Secretary's Division, separately;

(iii) whether it is an aid or a loan that the Government provides to rebuild such totally damaged houses, toilets and drinking water wells and reconstruct partially and slightly damaged houses, toilets and drinking water wells and the amount of aid or loan;
(iv) the number of totally, partially or slightly damaged houses, toilets and drinking water wells for which loans or aid have been provided by now; and
(v) the names, addresses, Grama Niladhari Divisions and Divisional Secretaries' Divisions of the families for which such aid or loan have been provided, separately?
(b) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa - Minister of Disaster Management) , * .
* .] [ ] [This annex is also placed in the Library.]
DPJ : CONSTRUCTION OF DPJ BUILDING IN RAJAGIRIYA: DETAILS
) ( - ( ) ) (The Hon. Nihal Galappaththi on behalf of the Hon. (Dr.) Nalinda Jayathissa) - (5 :
asked the Minister of Megapolis and Western Development:

(i) whether approval of the Urban Development Authority has been obtained for the purpose of constructing the building named DPJ located at No. 288 Sri Jayewardenepura Road, Kotte, Rajagiriya, which belongs to Mr. Upali Jayasinghe;
(ii) if so, the date on which such approval has been obtained;
(iii) what conditions were put forth by the Urban Development Authority for its construction;
(iv) whether they have been complied with; and
(v) if not, what measures have been taken by the Urban Development Authority against the organization?
(b) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Patali Champika Ranawaka - Minister of Megapolis and Western Development) , * .
: PRODUCTION AND CONSUMPTION OF EGGS: DETAILS
2146/57 12. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Heshan Withanage on behalf of the Hon. Ashoka Priyantha) - (5 :
asked the Minister of Rural Economic Affairs:
(i) the consumption of eggs in Sri Lanka from 2010 up to now in relation to each year, separately;
(ii) the manner through which that need is met;
(iii) the production of eggs in Sri Lanka in relation to each district, separately; and

(iv) the steps the Ministry intends to take to enhance the standard of living of egg producers in the Kurunegala and Puttalam Districts in the North Western Province, as a significant portion of the people in these two districts are engaged in this business?
) ( - . ) (The Hon. BandulaGunawardane on behalf of the Hon. T. Ranjith De Soyza) - (5 :
asked the Minister of Law and Order and Southern Development:
(i) whether the consumption of illicit liquor (Kasippu) has increased annually within the last few years;
(ii) whether the number of raids to seize illicit liquor (Kasippu) being carried out has been reduced;

(iii) the number of places raided that were selling illicit liquor (Kasippu) and the amount of litres of illicit liquor seized in the years of 2015, 2016 and within the first six months of the year 2017 separately in each year; and
(iv) the future measures that the Ministry will take to prevent illicit liquor (Kasippu) production?
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Piyasena Gamage - State Minister of Law and Order) , * .
: PROPAGATION OF PALM OIL CULTIVATION : ACTION TAKEN
) ( - ) (The Hon. Bandula Gunawardane on behalf of the Hon.Tharaka Balasuriya) - (5 :
() , ? asked the Minister of Plantation Industries:

(a) Will he inform this House- (i) approximate extent of Palm Oil cultivation in Sri Lanka, district wise; (ii) governments policy regarding the propagation of palm oil cultivation in Sri Lanka; (iii) whether the Ministry identifies a correlation between Palm Oil cultivation and water retention and soil disintegration; and (iv) if so, what action has been taken so far;
) ( - ) (The Hon. BandulaGunawardane on behalf of the Hon. Ishak Rahuman) , - (5 :
asked the Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine:
(a) Is he aware that the Padaviya Rural Hospital which has been established in the year 1972 has no facility as at today and become a central dispensary?
(b) Will he inform this House of the date on which arrangements would be made to reinstate this hospital?
( ) ( - , ) (The Hon. Faizal Cassim - Deputy Minister of Health, Nutrition and Indigenous Medicine) , , * .

SCARCITY OF TAMIL MEDIUM TECHNICAL OFFICERS IN DEPARTMENT OF METEOROLOGY:
( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Anura Priyadharshana Yapa - Minister of Disaster Management) , 2057.52.07 23(2 , "
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Hon. Member, I will finish this and give you the Floor later.
( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move,

"That notwithstanding the provisions of Standing Order No. 7 of the Parliament, and the motions agreed to by Parliament on 08.03.2016, the Parliament shall sit on Monday, February 19 , 2018 and the hours of sitting of Parliament this day shall be 10.00 a.m. to 12.30 p.m. and 1.30 p.m. to 6.30 p.m.. At 6.30 p.m. Mr. Speaker shall adjourn the Parliament without question put." . . Question put, and agreed to.

( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) Sir, I move, "That this Parliament at its rising this day do adjourn until 10.00 a.m. on Monday, February 19, 2018. " . . Question put, and agreed to. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) . ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, it was before the days Business started that I wanted to raise this point of Order.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) What is it about? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) As you are quite well aware, Sir, either under Personal Explanations or Questions of Privilege which come under Standing Order No. 19, I gave you a document.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Yes. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Subsequently, you spoke to me and said that it does not fall within both. I do not understand as to how this Parliament does not provide its Members an opportunity to explain when their privileges are impacted. I have been very clearly, emphatically mentioning that I would be making a statement today and on that basis, it was known what was the reason for. I have given a very detailed statement to you. So, I am lost for an answer. After 24 years in Parliament, I see an absolute case of injustice that is being meted out. On the preliminary basis, I must be told as to why it is not considered and the answer that was given was a flimsy answer. Apparently, that is what your staff has mentioned. So, I am ready to read out my statement on Privileges and I would greatly appreciate if you could give me the opportunity to go forward.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) , . , it does not fall within Questions of Privilege or Personal Explanations. It is very clear. . . - [ ] . . Standing Orders - Privilege matter - it does not fall within Questions of Privilege.

( ) (The Hon. Speaker) No, it does not come within Questions of Privilege. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) That is all. That is the explanation I can give you. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . . .
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , Right to Information Act 4,000 . .
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) . ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) . ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) . Bonds .

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Hon. Speaker, you have to protect our rights. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Of course. Definitely, I am doing that. ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) So, you must listen to what we are saying.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Yes, I am fully listening to you; I respect you. But today is not the opportune time and I cannot allow you to make that statement under Standing Orders.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, I very respectfully and humbly ask you, where does it not fall within the purview of Privileges? If you tell me which page and what substance, I will eradicate that.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) It will not fall within the issue of Privileges. That is the reason.
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Does it affect me only? ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) You wanted it to come under Privileges.

( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) No, I did not write it under Privileges. I had it open. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) But your letter clearly states that it is a Privilege issue. "Privilege issue" . . . argue . Standing Orders allow . .
( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) Sir, I rise to a point of Order.
( ) (The Hon. Speaker) What is your point of Order, Hon. Member?

[4.48p.m.] ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha - Minister of Provincial Councils and Local Government) Hon. Presiding Member, with regard to the Adjournment Motion moved by the Hon. S. Shritharan, I would like to place on record that this Thousand Rural Bridges Project is done in consultation with the Northern Provincial Council. It is not a programme
initiated through the Divisional Secretary. But I take the concerns raised by the Hon. Shritharan seriously.

There are 86 rural bridges being constructed in the Northern Province and I feel that we need to engage the Hon. Members of Parliament of those particular Districts in doing this. You have also raised certain issues on certain bridges that have been constructed. The overall project is funded by the United Kingdom and there is a local collaborator who works with them.

( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) Hon. Member, this has nothing to do with either the transport sector or the Ministry of Highways. This is the project that was initiated to empower thousand rural bridges. Anyway, I take the concerns you have raised. I have a list of rural bridges to be constructed. In the Northern Province, there are 86 bridges and I will give you all the details rather than mentioning them all at this forum. But, I believe that we can have a better consultative process with regard to the issues which you have raised.

In addition to that, Hon. Member, you were complaining about a British company, which is doing construction in the North without knowledge of the ecology there. I would like to say that this is done by having a meeting once a month with the participation of the Chief Secretary of each Province with my Secretary. So, if you have any issues with regard to rural bridges, I will call for a discussion specifically to deal with the Northern Province. Hereafter, when they decide on what bridges are to be built in the North, I will see that all the Members of Parliament of those particular Districts are informed and there is a far better consultative process.
( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) I will read it for you. . ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) , ! , , ? . , , ?
( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) It comes under the Ministry of Provincial Councils and Local Government and it is done in consultation with the Northern Provincial Council.

( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) Hon. Member, I am surprised to hear that he is not aware of it because once a month he participates in the Consultative Meeting with the Secretary to the Ministry of Provincial Councils and Local Government. Hon. Member, I do not want to go in for a confrontational dialogue with you. So, we will look into the issues which you have raised and move forward.

( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) We have Local Government Elections on the 10th of February. So, we will call for a meeting before the 28th of February. Hon. Member, do you want me to read the list of bridges or shall I table it?
. ( . ) (The Hon. S. Shritharan) Okay. ( ) (The Hon. Faiszer Musthapha) Then, I will table* the list of bridges together with the background information.
Parliament adjourned accordingly at 4.52 p.m. until 10.00 a.m. on Monday, 19th February, 2018 pursuant to the Resolution of Parliament of this Day.
Corrections which Members suggest for the Final Print should be clearly marked in their copy and sent to the Editor of HANSARD within two weeks
of receipt of the uncorrected copy.
